summary: The headcanon that Lawrence Lorelei is Tary’s husband is great because his siblings are all griping like “oh this Lycanthropy...
body: The headcanon that Lawrence Lorelei is Tary’s husband is great because his siblings are all griping like “oh this Lycanthropy curse! We are doomed to pass it on to our children! Woe is us!” And meanwhile Larry’s looking at the 70+ wayward children that Tary keeps bringing home to join the Brigade and insisting that they adopt them all, and just nods and goes “Nailed it.”

reblog.comment: The headcanon that Lawrence Lorelei is Tary’s husband is great because his siblings are all griping like “oh this Lycanthropy curse! We are doomed to pass it on to our children! Woe is us!” And meanwhile Larry’s looking at the 70+ wayward children that Tary keeps bringing home to join the Brigade and insisting that they adopt them all, and just nods and goes “Nailed it.”

Woe is us!” And meanwhile Larry’s looking at the 70+ wayward children that Tary keeps bringing home to join the Brigade and insisting that they adopt them all, and just nods and goes “Nailed it.”

summary: The Legend of Vox Machina Kickstarter ends tonight!
body:
The Legend of Vox Machina Kickstarter ends tonight!

If you haven’t donated already, you should!! ‘But it’s already fully funded and them some!’ I hear you say. Well here are a few reasons why you should should still donate.

Not only would you get to be part of the reason they get to make this project, but every extra dollar is going back into the animation. So this project is gonna be made more awesome by every new donation. Plus, the more awesome it gets, the more views it will get and the more seasons we will get.

Depending on your donation level there are some awesome goodies to be had. Dice, bags, trinket plushie, cards, beanies, posters etc. Gotta have that swag.

Plus you get guaranteed access to watch it when it comes out. How frustrating would it be to find out next year its gonna be streamed on a service you don’t have… or can’t get in your country. You may have to pay to get access anyway. Better to put that money straight towards the project.

Even if it’s only a few dollars/pounds/euros/blood sacrifices it’ll be worth it to see the kick ass, hilarious, heart wrenching, surprising, loveable and awe inspiring Legend of Vox Machina animation.

summary: Caleb: You two, circus people. Mollymauk. Molly: Yeah, yeah. Caleb: Could--ah, that’s cute. Could the two of you do something...
body:
Caleb: You two, circus people. Mollymauk.

Molly: Yeah, yeah.

Caleb: Could–ah, that’s cute. Could the two of you do something fabulous over there?

Yasha: Make a distraction?

Caleb: Ja.

Nott: juggle something?

Yasha: Yeah, I could uh…have you stand on my shoulders.

And then, predictably, Yasha throws Molly balls-first into a fence.

…Also, this is so that they could steal a bucket.

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

summary: Photoshop 2019 April: Hello, everyone! I have some exciting news! I’ve currently joined a D&D group. I’ve always been fascinated...
caption:
Photoshop 2019 April: Hello, everyone! I have some exciting news! I’ve currently joined a D&D group. I’ve always been fascinated with the idea of D&D and a friend of mine asked if I wanted to join their group, so of course, I said yes. For reasons explained below, I have only a few days to work on my character and I finally finished. This is Astraea, a High (Moon) Elf who performs the role of Cleric in the group. I took from the colors of the moon elves in the Netflix show, The Dragon Prince. Teal, silver, and blue are some of my favorite colors so I was eager to use them in this piece.

However, I have possible sad news as well. I recently got accepted into my dream college and will be transferring their this week! The sad news is that I can’t take my desktop out there until around August so, I might not post digital art until that time comes. I will try to find a workaround, but I can’t promise, sorry!

CLICK FOR BETTER QUALITY!

Reblog, Love, Follow

blog.name: the-punslinger
blog.title: Mostly punzerking on Pundora
blog.description:
My name is a fruit. I'm just a 27-y.o. INFJ bi/pansexual postgrad student of (medieval) English, burying the world in puns. I love music, gaming, books, archery, and tv series. Here to reblog art and memes from my favourite games and series. I'm currently very much Critical Role trash.
Favourites: 
Borderlands / Dragon Age / Mass Effect / Life is Strange / JSRF / Mad Max / TES / Kingkiller Chronicles / 
ASoIaF.

summary: I am now catching up on Critical Role episode 58, where Laura gets her “Bailey Brig” dice jail... and I just wanna say they...
body:
I am now catching up on Critical Role episode 58, where Laura gets her “Bailey Brig” dice jail…

and I just wanna say they really missed out on the opportunity to call it the Laura Bailey Dice Jaily.
